title: We Need to Start Redeeming What Has Been Lost, Not Bringing in More New
body:
**Champions That Need VUs/VGUs/GUs:**
(some have been stated by Riot themselves)
{{champion:266}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:32}} {{champion:34}} {{champion:268}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:69}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:42}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:28}} {{champion:9}} {{champion:3}} {{champion:79}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:40}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:429}} {{champion:38}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:56}} {{champion:20}} {{champion:80}} {{champion:33}} {{champion:68}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:72}} {{champion:50}} {{champion:17}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:77}} {{champion:6}} {{champion:45}} {{champion:8}} {{champion:106}} {{champion:19}} {{champion:5}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:26}} 

In 2016, a total of 6 new champions released, pushing the art style and gameplay priorities of League of Legends further into the future. In comparison, a total of 4 champions were updated individually in 2016, being Shen, Taric, Ryze, and Yorick. There was also the Mage Update and Assassin Update, but it is safe to say that SOME of the champions updated there are still in this list and were more made better to make them not quite as bad during the wait for their updates. What I'm saying is that, with this speed, champions aren't getting updated fast enough and more and more champions will begin to fill this list. More and more will need updates until League of Legends will look like a Frankenstein of varying art styles spread out over many years of development. It will look really bad.

Riot Games, you need more teams designated to Champion Updates. The list above doesn't even include some of the ones that MIGHT need a VU since they have aged relatively well. Currently, it seems you have 2 Champion-Up teams. I think that number needs to be doubled or at least be bumped up to 3. The list is getting larger by the day and we already have about a fifth of the roster here. Slow down new champions until the rest of the game is out of the Ice Age.

Some of these are strange even to me, but have been stated by Riot to be on "The List". This is the likes of Cho'Gath, Rammus, Teemo, Volibear, etc. Some in the VU department may also questionably need a GU as well, such as Vladimir and Nocturne.
P.S. The reason Rumble is in the VU is mainly due to his "rig" still making it insanely hard to make skins for him.

Riot has said they've actually slowed down new champion production to work on upgrading existing champions, but even at this effort it's not going to be enough. How long have WW and Galio been in the works? The better part of a year, in the werewolf's case. That's too long, considering the list of champs that need modernizing is only going to get longer as the months go by.

Updates need to either be quicker, or there needs to be more champs getting updated at the same time.

For me personally, I would _gladly_ sacrifice new champs to update older ones quicker for a season or two. The big reworks tend to end up being a practically new champion in the end, so I don't see the downside here.

Well, I **do** see the downside here. Lots of players already own the champs getting updated, so there's not going to be that RP splurge that comes with the debut of a new champ if a large portion of your playerbase gets it for free. Yes, selling the reworked skins can bring in some money, but I'd be willing to bet Riot didn't make half the money off the Yorick rework than they did Camille.

The downside is when they mess up a rework it takes away a champion that a lot of people have put hundreds or thousands of hours into.

They have been getting better at reworking champs, but if they rush the reworks too much and start throwing new/un-experienced development teams into the mix, they risk breaking the game for a lot of people and losing customers for no gain.

To answer why Cho'Gath needs a VGU:

His kit is outdated and doesn't have any coherency to it, he basically has a dead ability come mid-late game in his e.  He's frustrating to play against when ahead due to massive damage and high inherent tankiness but, conversely, falls off the planet if he gets behind because he actually loses tankiness with every death.  He's the second mage-tank along with Galio and, much like Galio, needs a rework to improve his thematics and game health.  VU-wise while his model is _okay_ it could be better and his particles are absolutely atrocious.
